main event: Multiple witnesses observed a fast, disc-shaped object over Brunswick, Georgia, on March 9, 1950.
interesting points: The estimated speed of the objects was between 1,800 to 2,000 miles an hour,The objects were described as saucer-shaped but flat on the bottom,The sighting included a retired officer and four experienced aviators,The aircraft were first seen going southwest before disappearing and reappearing going north,Many people initially mistook the objects for ordinary aircraft until they passed overhead at high speed.
witness description: a retired officer and four experienced aviators, along with additional witnesses on the ground
